comment: What set him apart was the energy he brought into every lecture. His class was the only one I attended every single session not because I had to, but because I wanted to. He made learning something to look forward to.

Show up, ask for help, and follow directions. Simple expectations, yes but powerful. Those rules weren't just about passing the class; they were about building responsibility and a willingness to grow. And he held us to that standard every day, not through pressure, but through encouragement and belief in our potential

Having him as a teacher has been one of the most impactful and memorable experiences of my academic journey. He brought so much more than just knowledge into the classroom—he brought care, integrity, and a genuine desire to see his students grow, both intellectually and personally.

TAKE HIM! Personally my favorite professor here at KSU. If he instructed every class I would take him over and over again. He really cares about his students and very respectful. I finally feel like I learned something in a class. His teaching style addresses all learning styles. Plus he's accessible outside of accessible outside of class.

He is the most impactful professor I've had. Not only does he have an incredible background in public health but he is caring, supportive, a father-figure who gives great advice, but most of all, authentic. He has truly saved my life, I had him in the Fall and took an elective class just to have him again. Shame on KSU for not bringing him back!!!!

Great professor who really enjoys what he does. Class is mainly discussion posts and attendance is taken by random quizzes in class, but they are very easy. Very positive attitude and is willing to help. He has a grace week at the end of the semester which is very helpful. Show up and you'll be good.

Dr. Kaufman is one of the best professors I've ever had and he truly cares about his students and has a true passion for Public Health. The class was super easy and straightforward really all you have to do is show up! Im super sad that this is his last semester teaching and I won't have the pleasure of being in his class again :(

This is the best professor I have EVER had, he made my junior year! I am devastated that I won't be able to take another class with him. His lectures are filled with knowledge & you can tell he truly cares for his students. All the assignments were straight forward,  all he wants you to do is show up, ask for help when needed, & follow directions.

He is simply the best professor at KSU. It's disheartening to know this is his last semester and the negative comments on his course. He cares so much about his students. I could go on and on about how great he is. Truly cares about students.

Not sure why he has so many low ratings because Professor Kaufman is hands down the best professor I have ever had. I am so happy I was able to catch him on his last semester teaching here, because he gave me such a great outlook on life and his wise words honestly helped me in so many ways. If you ever have the opportunity to take his class, DO IT

I failed a nursing school class, so I retook the class and picked up an elective. It's shocking to say, but I'm glad I failed that class because I would've never experienced his wise words & amazing lectures. I looked forward to his class, but unfortunately, he won't be teaching anymore, so I'm glad I caught him in his last semester here. Great man

I'm not sure why his ratings are so low, but in my experience, he's been the most impactful professor I've had since enrolling at KSU. He encourages critical thinking while also teaching the importance of valuing those around you. His class challenged me in ways that helped me grow both academically and personally.

Professor Kaufman has probably been the best professor male professor I've had in my entire life. He walks into the classroom with such a positive and radiant attitude. He keeps everything real and really cares for his students. He is an expert at what he does and teaches. In class he shares 3 principles that will set you up to succeed in life!

Professors who are as passionate about teaching as he is and genuinely care about the welfare of their students - is very rare to find. Attendance is highly encouraged. There are pop quizzes you don't want to miss. You are inspired to think in this class and reflect on ways in which you can better your life and the lives of others around you.
Genuine.  Experienced.  Wise.

Professor Kaufman is very passionate about what he teaches and encourages us to participate in his lectures. His classes were always engaging by using real-life occurrences that related to his lectures. He makes sure to emphasize important dates, is clear with his instructions, and shows compassion for his students.

Professor Sean is honestly one
the best professors that I have had at this school. To get the highest grade in the class, you have to show up. Attendance is not mandatory, however, he does do pop quizzes to ensure that students do not just skip classes. He provided answers to all tests in the class during a review session.

Great professor, show up and you'll receive real world implication of lectures and stay up to date about world and public health events and what that may mean in the future. Very knowledgeable professor in the profession of public health.

A good instructor, but very strict about deadlines and attendance. He values participation and expects consistent class presence. Most classes include quizzes to track attendance, so valid excuses with documentation are important. A grace period is offered at the end of the semester, but if you've missed too much, make-up work won't be allowed.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Kaufman is the first professor who made me genuinely excited to attend class. His lectures changed how I view my life. The class is easy if you follow directions and show up. He's an amazing professor, and I truly wish I could take more courses with him in the future.

Professor Kaufman is a great professor who cares a lot about the success of his students. He provides clear directions to be a successful student and also has many contact methods so he can communicate with his students in a timely manner. This semester I learned a lot and will always remember Professor Kaufman as a wonderful educator and mentor.

This professor was one of the best professors I've ever had. I genuinely don't think I have ever been able to understand content from any other class until this one. It made me excited for Tuesday and Thursday and I could not wait to come to class. I would definitely take him if you are wanting inspiration and honesty about life.

This is the best professor that I've ever had. I don't even write reviews but he's worth it. He doesn't just read from power points like most professors, but his class is actually really engaging. He actually cares about the wellbeing of students and sets them up for success in life.
this is the best professor i've had!! he's very caring and cares about your education. as long as you come to class and follow the rules, you will pass!!

BEST professor i've ever taken in my life, not over with the semester yet but he truly changed my life. I come home everyday and tell my roomates something he taught us. So engaging and fun. Made me like going to class again.

Professor Kaufman is an amazing person. His lectures were straight to the point and easy to understand, the tests were reviewed beforehand (so nothing on said test should surprise you), and he was also very easy to reach (for any questions). Honestly, the best class I've ever taken!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Great Professor!! It's imperative that you follow instructions and complete assignments on time. Mr. Kaufman prepares his students for the real world and shows how important it is for critical thinking. Make sure you follow the syllabus and turn in assignments on time.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He's a good professor. As long as you show up to class and do the work, you will be fine.

One of the easiest professors ever! Attendance matters but the class is not bad to attend, it is interactive and shows he cares about the field he teaches. He did a full review day that gave the answers to the test, a few discussion posts, and one big project that was a good experience. Take him in person! No regrets and an easy grade!

class mainly consists of discussion posts with three exams, all of which he gives a full day of review for that are very helpful. there are pop quizzes, but just as a form of attendance. he is very passionate about his work and is truly inspirational. he is easy to contact and will get back with you in a timely manner. taking another class of his!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Amazing professor! He wrote my recommendation letter for grad school. Highly recommend.
Such an inspiring professor. I took both of him courses. Great Guy
The best professor I ever had all 4 years at KSU. I learned more in his singular class than I learned my entire time at this school.

Concerned by this low RMP rating. His lectures are the most engaging I've experienced at KSU. Attendance is mandatory but if you're there you'll never miss his pop quizzes, which are just checks for attendance. Provides a full review day for exams, GO TO THEM. Days off in sylly! Workload isn't heavy just attend class; he truly wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Kaufman was truly such an amazing professor, something I admire about him was how passionate he is with what he does. He does not read straight from the powerpoint but has an open discussion about them and challenges you to think critically. Theres easy discussion boards, and 3 tests he went over all in lecture. He wants you to succeed.

I took Professor Kaufman for IHS 2100 Summer Online. I don't quite understand why there are so many negative reviews on Prof Kaufman, but your grade in this class heavily depends on if you know EXACTLY what each assignment is and WHEN it is due. Discussion posts were the majority of the assignments given, along with some bigger assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Consistently inconsistent assumes you know what to do on assignments when he barely gives direction then will grade you poorly when you can't do it perfectly as he wants because he didn't tell you, didn't learn anything because he was never available for clarification lucky to survive with the grade I did
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: he is extremely Inconsistent. and doesn't respond in a timely fashion. he doesn't use a textbook and then asks you to reference materials from the course textbook
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Simply terrible i feel bad for anyone who has to take him
class was easy but the professor is MIA 95% of the time
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: this man does not need to be teaching
Simply awful! class was easy but this professor does NOT need to be teaching at a university. We could never get a response in time. or if we did the assignment was already due a week or two prior.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: doesn't care for his students more worried about getting elected to his neighborhood school board. how this man was hired by on of the largest universities in the state is crazy to me.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: RUN! he showed a clear lack of engagement and commitment. He took a two-week vacation for a campaign with his family, leaving students without guidance. This absence hindered our ability to grasp the material. Instead of using the textbook, he relied almost exclusively on YouTube videos, further impacting our learning.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Attend every lecture, it is for your own good. Great teacher, brings up discussions and lessons to develop the students in their fields and provide them a feel and basis of their major. I would highly recommend taking the course if you are willing to attend the class you are paying for.

Y'all all you have to do is go to class. Literary go to class and you wont fail. He does in class quizzes that count for assignments as attendance at the end of the semester. Assignments he does are not hard.

Professor Kaufman was more than gracious to us students. He gave us multiple opportunities for extra credit and extended projects until the very last day of the semester. Professor Kaufman also reviewed the test prior to the test in class. I do highly suggest that you do attend class. I highly recommend this Professor.

many group projects, very unorganized, assumes you know what to do on assignments when he barely gives direction then will grade you poorly when you can't do it perfectly because he didn't tell you, didn't learn anything bc he rants during class the whole time, not sure how he teaches phe when he doesn't believe in masks or certain vaccines
